status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.customfield_10312: # [In the AR email sent] allow for a link that lands the user on to this page and then have the toggle be switched off
fields.description:
As a buyer, I would like a switch for "Automated Recommendation," so I do not receive alert emails anymore.  

*Use case updates:* 

If the user clicks the unsubscribe link in the footer of the email (no matter if the user login/not login/registered/not registered)
 * We will automatically turn off the recommendation for the user from the backend after the user clicks the link.
 * We will not sign up the user for another automated recommendation for the next 10 months, unless the user turns the automated recommendation on again from the My Alert page.  
 * The user will land on a SRP page with the same "subscription" criteria. 
 * On the top of the page, there will be a message saying " You have been successfully unsubscribed from the recommendation alert. If you want to turn it on again, please go to My Alert page."  +Translation+: "Te has dado de baja exitosamente de nuestra alertas con recomendaciones. Si quieres suscribirte otra vez, por favor ve a la sección Mis Alertas." Message look design please see the attachment of Gumtree example.

comments.body: [~john]  Can you refine AC 5? I think we can allow people to unsubscribe to these emails through the email sent itself. May be we need to add utm code instead and then just check this off.

[~homer], right now we have a change email preference link in the footer to link to this page, do you mean once the user click the link, we automatically turn it off? Instead of land the user on the email preference page to turn it off him/herself?

[~homer] just added the criteria to allow ALL users opt-out for 10 months by only click on the unsubscribing link in the email. If a user is a renter, they may look for apartment again after 10 months. What do you think?
[~john] if user Unsubscribe failed , what message should we display ? can help provide translated message
Hi [~spielberg], this is an interesting question! Could you give me more context on why the unsubscribe could be failed? Thank you
[~john] , if the unsubscribe token was not correct, it will be failed. currently, the email address are encrypted, if not correct, the unsubscribe action will be failed

There are several cases for failed unsubscribing:
1. There are some bugs in ULIVZ code which causes failure

2. The link is created by some attacker with invalid token and accessed by victim.

So maybe some general error message is OK, such as:
1. Invalid token, please contact us.
2. Unknown error, please contact us.

Thanks so much for the explanation! Very helpful. [~spielberg] [~spliu]

Let's use land on SRP with this message on top: "An error occurred, please contact us or try again: the correct link" 

Let me get you the Spanish translation as soon as I have it.
"Ha currido un error, por favor contactenos o intente otra vez."
[~john] Usually we will not put this link into page because this link is confidential but it will be shown in URL. How about just "An error occurred, please contact us or try again."

items.fromString:
# A switch at the bottom that turns off notifications from "Automated Recommendations" email
 # The preference is respected going forward until a user unselect it
 # It goes after all other alerts
 # Have a "Save changes" button to save all of the changes user made or have automatic saves [may be not needed if changes are real time?]
items.toString:

 # It goes after all other alerts

 # [In the AR email sent] allow for a link that lands the user on to this page and then have the toggle be switched off

items.fromString:
As a buyer, I would like a switch for "Automated Recommendation," so I do not receive alert emails anymore. 

Create a separate section on My Alert page to allow users to manage the subscription of "Automated Recommendations"

 

Design: Basic modifications of 1.0 page – 

ZA, SG, IE, PL: zpl.io/2jkprEm
 AR: zpl.io/aNBEGdv
 MX: zpl.io/aNBEGLZ

 

Translation: [~homer] (see attachment)
items.toString:
As a buyer, I would like a switch for "Automated Recommendation," so I do not receive alert emails anymore. 

Create a separate section on My Alert page to allow users to manage the subscription of "Automated Recommendations"

Design: Basic modifications of 1.0 page – 

ZA, SG, IE, PL: zpl.io/2jkprEm
 AR: zpl.io/aNBEGdv
 MX: zpl.io/aNBEGLZ

Translation: see design. 

 

*Here are the use cases:* 
 # If the user mange the automated recommendation through the website, the user will use the My Alert page. 
 #  If the user clicks the unsubscribe link in the footer of the email (no matter if the user login/not login/registered/not registered)
 ** we will automatically turn off the alert for the user from the backend after the user clicks the link.
 ** we will not sign up the user for another automated recommendation for the next 10 month, unless the user turn the automated recommendation on again from the My Alert page.  
 ** the user will land to a SRP page with the same "subscription" criteria. 
 ** on the top of the page, there will be a message saying " You have been successfully unsubscribed from the recommendation alert. If you want to turn it on again, please go to My Alert page."
